features.title: Data Provenance Indicators
features.summary: Visual convention distinguishing Google Sheets data (unlabeled), AI assessments (purple), and live market data (cyan with freshness).
features.description:
Traders can now instantly identify the source of every data element on the portfolio pages.

**AI provenance (purple):** The AI Risk Assessment section on deal detail pages now has a purple left border and a small "AI" pill next to the heading. Discrepancy labels changed from yellow to purple ("AI: value") to align with the AI color convention. The Risk column header on the listing page also shows an "AI" pill since that column is entirely AI-sourced.

**Live market data (cyan with freshness):** Options sections show a "LIVE" pill during market hours or "PRIOR CLOSE" when markets are closed. The market data status dot is now freshness-aware: green when data is <90s old, amber when stale, gray when disconnected. The status label appends "(stale)" when amber. Live price text dims from cyan-400 to cyan-600 when data is stale (>5 minutes).

**Google Sheets data (unlabeled):** Sheet-sourced sections (Deal Terms, Key Dates, Deal Assessment, risk badges) remain unlabeled as the default baseline -- labeling them would add noise since they represent ~90% of the data.

**Pages affected:** /sheet-portfolio (listing), /sheet-portfolio/[ticker] (deal detail), /sheet-portfolio/[ticker]/options (options detail).

features.title: Smart Model Routing & Batch API
features.summary: Risk assessments now route to Opus 4.6, Sonnet 4.6, or Haiku 4.5 based on change significance, with batch API for 50% cost savings.
features.description:
The risk assessment engine now intelligently selects the right Claude model for each deal based on how much has changed since the last assessment.

**Model routing by significance:**
- MAJOR changes (new deals, large regulatory shifts) → Opus 4.6 ($5/$25 per MTok) for maximum quality
- MODERATE changes (price moves, timeline updates) → Sonnet 4.6 ($3/$15 per MTok) for strong analysis
- MINOR changes (small news, routine filings) → Haiku 4.5 ($1/$5 per MTok) for fast, cheap updates
- NO_CHANGE → Reuse previous assessment (no API call, $0)

**Batch API integration:** All API-needing assessments are submitted as a single Anthropic Batch API request instead of sequential calls. This provides a 50% discount on all token costs. Feature-gated by RISK_BATCH_MODE env var.

**Prompt caching:** System prompts are cached with ephemeral cache_control, providing 90% discount on cache reads across batch requests sharing the same system prompt.

**Projected cost:** ~$0.30/run for 20 deals (down from ~$0.60+ with all-Sonnet sequential).

features.title: Prediction System Guide
features.summary: New user-facing documentation page explaining the 5-phase prediction system, smart routing, and cost optimization.
features.description:
A comprehensive guide at /user-guide documents the entire prediction assessment system.

**Sections covered:**
- Overview of the 5-phase prediction loop
- Phase 1: Enriched Context (options-implied probability, three-signal triangulation, milestones)
- Phase 2: Prediction Registry (falsifiable predictions, auto-resolution, Brier scoring)
- Phase 3: Calibration Loop (calibration curves, bias detection, prompt feedback)
- Phase 4: Human Review Queue (review triggers, annotation workflow, corrections)
- Phase 5: Signal Weighting (historical accuracy, inverse-Brier weights)
- Smart Routing (how change significance determines strategy and model)
- Cost Optimization (batch API, caching, model routing savings)
- How to Use (running assessments, reading results, interpreting grades)

Accessible from the dashboard homepage via a new link in the Event Driven section.
